hints.content:
Safari City has $\greenD{21}$ elephants.  How many pictures are above Safari City on the picture graph?


[[☃ image 1]]

$\blueD3$ pictures are above Safari City.  

$\blueD3 \times \,\maroonD{?} = \greenD{21}$

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Zoo and the vertical axis labeled Elephants. Each Zoo is listed along the horizontal axis from left to right as follows: Safari City, Zooville, Animal Land, and Tusk Town. The number of elephants for each zoo is represented by the number of pictures of elephants plotted on the graph. Safari City is represented by 3 pictures of elephants, Zooville is represented by 4 pictures of elephants, Animal Land is represented by 5 pictures of elephants, and Tusk Town is represented by 2 pictures of elephants. 3 pictures of elephants above Safari City are labeled from 1 at the bottom to 3 at the top. !

hints.content:
$\blueD3 \times \maroonD{7} = \greenD{21}$

Let's see if $\maroonD{7} $ works for the other zoos.

[[☃ image 1]]

Zoo  || Number of elephants
:- | :-: | :-: 
Safari City | $\blueD3  \times \maroonD{7} = \greenD{21}$| $\greenD{21}$ 
Zooville |$\greenD4 \times \maroonD{7} = \greenD{28}$| $\greenD{28}$   
Animal Land | $\purpleD5  \times \maroonD{7} = \greenD{35}$| $\greenD{35}$ 
Tusk Town | $\goldE2  \times \maroonD{7} = \greenD{14}$| $\greenD{14}$

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Zoo and the vertical axis labeled Elephants. Each Zoo is listed along the horizontal axis from left to right as follows: Safari City, Zooville, Animal Land, and Tusk Town. The number of elephants for each zoo is represented by the number of pictures of elephants plotted on the graph. Safari City is represented by 3 pictures of elephants, Zooville is represented by 4 pictures of elephants, Animal Land is represented by 5 pictures of elephants, and Tusk Town is represented by 2 pictures of elephants. 4 pictures of elephants above Zooville are labeled from 1 at the bottom to 4 at the top. 5 pictures of elephants above Animal Land are labeled from 1 at the bottom to 5 at the top. 2 pictures of elephants above Tusk Town are labeled 1 at the bottom and 2 at the top. !

hints.content:
On the picture graph, each 

[[☃ image 1]]

 equals $\maroonD{7} $ elephants.

question.content:
Laura is a zookeeper who loves elephants. All of the zookeepers created a chart and picture graph to show how many elephants each zoo has.

Zoo  | Number of elephants
:- | :-: 
Safari City | $21$ 
Zooville | $28$ 
Animal Land | $35$ 
Tusk Town | $14$ 


[[☃ image 1]]

 

[[☃ image 2]]

**On the picture graph, each**

[[☃ image 3]]

**equals [[☃ input-number 2]] elephants.**

options.alt: A picture of an elephant equals question mark elephants. !

A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Zoo and the vertical axis labeled Elephants. Each Zoo is listed along the horizontal axis from left to right as follows: Safari City, Zooville, Animal Land, and Tusk Town. The number of elephants for each zoo is represented by the number of pictures of elephants plotted on the graph. Safari City is represented by 3 pictures of elephants, Zooville is represented by 4 pictures of elephants, Animal Land is represented by 5 pictures of elephants, and Tusk Town is represented by 2 pictures of elephants. !
